title: Baofeng
author: Baofeng
content: In a twist of faith, Faruk Fatih Özer, who is the founder of Thodex, a Turkish crypto exchange, was found guilty and sentenced to 11,196 years, r with $5-million fine.QuoteAnnouncing its decision, the court panel sentenced detained defendants Faruk Fatih Özer, Güven Özer and Serap Özer to 11 thousand 190 years and 6 months each for the crimes of "establishing, managing and being a member of an organization", "qualified fraud" and "laundering of assets". gave a prison sentence.https://www.aa.com.tr/tr/gundem/thodexin-kurucusu-faruk-fatih-ozerin-dolandiricilik-davasinda-karar/2986295 I used Google TranslateI think this is the biggest sentenced that I have heard involving scammers and criminals in the crypto industry and probably this is what we call justice as for sure they can't get out of jail and will be their for the rest of their natural life.

He has been charged with aggravated fraud, money laundering and leading a criminal organization. I'm not sympathizing with him, but isn't 11,196 years way too much? I don't know what the law says about crimes like this in Turkey, maybe they want to make an example of him. It gets even worse that his brother and sister share the shame fate with him. It serves them right, I'm glad justice is finally served and they are all going rot to in jail.

comments.author: Lucius
comments.body: It is not disputed that a man should be punished if he is proven guilty, but I have never understood the point of such long-term sentences, considering that people live on average less than 100 years in ideal conditions. Maybe when he dies, they will bury him inside the prison walls and keep him that way for the next 11 000+ years?Justice is that the man responsible for the crime is in prison, but the sentence in itself has no meaning and it wouldn't make any difference if they sentenced him to 100 years in prison without the possibility of parole. If Bankman and Kwon had found themselves in that country, they would probably have received 100 000 years in prison each individually.

comments.author: Potato Chips
comments.body: What if I tell you the authorities were actually aiming to sentence him for 40,000 years? lmao, see: https://www.tomshardware.com/news/thodex-crypto-exchange-founder-busted-faces-40000-years-in-jail -- a year old articleThese figures are bonkers I know, but this reminded me of multiple life sentences for people with multiple charges, perhaps the concept is similiar in turkish law.Quote from: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Back-to-back_life_sentencesThis is a common punishment for a defendant convicted of multiple murder in the United States. Depending on the jurisdiction in which the case is tried, a defendant receiving a life sentence may become eligible for parole after serving a minimum length of time, on the order of 15–25 years. If a back-to-back penalty is imposed, the defendant must serve that minimum for every life sentence before parole can be granted. Such a penalty also ensures that even if some of the murder convictions are overturned on appeal, the defendant must still serve the sentences for the ones left standing. I don't think it's wrong that Turkey is being harsh on these people, they deserve it with the amount of damage they caused to many people.
